New Records: Nishan Velupillay made his international debut for Australia and scored his first goal for the Socceroos.
Australia secured a 3-1 victory over China in their FIFA World Cup qualifier, marking a significant achievement under coach Tony Popovic.
Key Match Events: Velupillay scored the winning goal in stoppage time to give Australia a 3-1 lead.
Craig Goodwin was named Player of the Match for his impressive performance and goal contribution.
Australia overcame early goals from China to secure the win.
Pre-Game Insights: The match was seen as a crucial step for Australia in their World Cup qualifiers, with expectations tied to the new coaching regime and team dynamics.
Post-Match Reflections: Tony Popovic praised the team's resilience and expressed confidence in their ability to compete against tougher opponents, such as Japan in their next match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Adelaide Oval, with a large crowd supporting the Socceroos, reflecting strong local interest and support.
